newsitem.title: USA: Intel, SAP form e-commerce venture.
newsitem.headline: Intel, SAP form e-commerce venture.

text.p: Chipmaker Intel Corp and German business software giant SAP AG have formed a joint venture to sell the hardware and software that businesses need to set up shop on the Internet, the companies said Tuesday.
The venture will help customers chase after the $200 billion in transactions that is expected to be conducted through the global computer network.
Intel, which is looking for more venues to sell its computer chips, will supply the servers. SAP will supply the computer programs that track inventory, order entry and accounts payable.
Terms of ownership of the joint venture were not immediately available.
The companies said they both will contribute staff and technical resources to the venture. An Intel executive will serve as the chairman and a SAP executive as president and chief executive.

At a demonstration in San Francisco, the companies previewed a combination of hardware and software that would let customers order products through the Web, let a merchant track inventory levels, place orders from a supplier, and let a merchant's accountants keep track of financial records.
